medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at varying ages, with individual lesions present for a few weeks to a few years. Notably, one patient (age 7) presented with an elevated pink papule on the left thigh, with gradual development of new melanocytic nevi over time, showing no sudden increases in number.
medical_history.family_history: One patient reported a cousin with Spitz nevi. No known family history of cutaneous melanoma was mentioned for other patients.
